notes: Discarding a broken stick, as per Rule 3.2 (a), will not be penalized unless it interferes with the play or is done in such a way that poses a risk to other participants.
This is a delayed penalty but will be assessed regardless of whether the thrown stick or object actually makes contact with an opposing player or the puck.

subsection.text: A Minor penalty will be assessed to any player who: i. Throws, shoots, or kicks a stick or any part thereof, or any other object in the neutral or attacking zone. A Penalty Shot will be awarded to the non-offending team, in lieu of a Minor Penalty, when a player: ii. Throws, shoots, or kicks a stick or any part thereof, or any other object at the puck or puck carrier in the defending zone. iii. Throws, shoots, or kicks a stick or any part thereof, or any other object at an opposing player, who is on a breakaway in the neutral or attacking zone. If any of the above actions are committed by a team official or player on the Players' or Penalty Benches, they must be penalized under Rule 8.4 (a) – Interference from the Bench.
A Major penalty and Game Misconduct will be assessed to any player who injures an opponent by any action described in 10.5 (a).

A Match penalty will be assessed to any player who, in the opinion of the Referee, attempts to injure or deliberately injures an opponent by throwing, shooting, or kicking a stick or any part thereof, or any other object.
A Misconduct penalty will be assessed to any player who deliberately throws or shoots a stick or any part thereof, or any object outside the playing area.
A Game Misconduct penalty must be assessed any time a Major penalty is assessed under this rule, as detailed under Rule 10.5 (b).

rule.title: Illegal Equipment
rule.text: Illegal equipment refers to any equipment that does not meet the requirements detailed in Section 3 of the Playing Rules.
notes: In the case of 3.6 (a), a warning may be issued prior to a minor penalty.
In the case of Rule 3.7, a warning will be issued to the team and subsequent violations by any member of that team will result in a minor penalty.
This is a delayed penalty. The only circumstance in which play will be stopped immediately is if a player participates in play without a helmet or facial protection.
No goal may be retroactively washed out if a player is found to have violated this rule.

subsection.text: A Minor penalty will be assessed to any player who uses equipment that does not conform to the following rules: •Rule 3.1 (g) – Measurement of Equipment •Rule 3.2 (a) – Lost or Broken Sticks – "Playing with a Broken Stick" •Rule 3.2 (b) – Lost or Broken Sticks – "Receiving an illegal Stick" •Rule 3.2 (c) – Lost of Broken Sticks – "Illegal Goaltender's Stick" •Rule 3.3 - Sticks •Rule 3.4 (a), (b) or (c) - Skates •Rule 3.5 – Goaltender's Equipment •Rule 3.6 – Protective Equipment •Rule 3.7 – Dangerous or Non-Standard Equipment •Rule 3.9 (a) – Jersey-Tie Down – Junior/Senior A Bench Minor penalty will be assessed to any team that violates Rule 2.3 (a) – Team Captains.
No Major penalty may be assessed for Illegal Equipment.
No Match penalty may be assessed for Illegal Equipment.

After one warning to the team, a Misconduct penalty will be assessed to any player who wears their helmet, facial protector, neck guard, or mouth guard improperly (Rule 3.6 (f) – Protective Equipment). A Misconduct Penalty, in addition to a Minor penalty, will be assessed to any player who refuses to surrender or breaks their stick, when requested by the Referee for the purposes of measurement (Rule 3.3 – Sticks). A Misconduct Penalty will be assessed to any player who undoes their chinstrap to incite or challenge an opponent but does not actually participate in a fight.
No Game Misconduct penalty may be assessed under this rule.

A Gross Misconduct penalty will be assessed for the following actions: i. Any player who refuses to remove or alter a piece of equipment after being assessed a Minor penalty because the Referee has deemed it dangerous or uncertified or illegal. ii. Any player who refuses to remove their helmet or facial protector for the purposes of identification, when asked to do so by the Referee. iii. Any player who intentionally removes their helmet before or during a fight OR undoes their chinstrap before or during a fight and that helmet subsequently comes off during the fight. iv. Any player who intentionally removes another player's helmet before or during a fight OR undoes another player's chinstrap before or during a fight and that helmet subsequently comes off during the fight.

rule.title: Too Many Players
rule.text: A team that places or has more than the permitted number of players on the ice at any time will be assessed a penalty for Too Many Players. Players may enter the ice only as a substitute for a player who is leaving the ice. When the substituting player enters the ice before the departing player is within three metres (10 ft.) of the Players' Bench and that player becomes involved in play, the penalty will be assessed.
notes: If the player leaving the ice is struck by the puck, there will be no penalty assessed, provided they are not involved in the play in any manner.
When a goaltender has been removed from the ice for an extra attacker, they will not be permitted to return to the ice during the same stoppage of play.

subsection.text: A Minor penalty will be assessed to any team that places more than the allowable number of players on the ice at any one time during play. A Bench Minor penalty will be assessed to any team that, by reason of a premature substitution of a goaltender, causes a stoppage of play. The offending team will not be permitted to change any players except for the goaltender. The substitute player(s) may not come onto the ice until the player(s) being substituted, including the goaltender, are within three metres (10 ft.) of the Players' Bench and are effectively out of play. The penalty will be assessed if a team, deliberately or inadvertently, places too many players on the ice and play continues. If a Team Official deliberately places more than the allowable number of players on the ice while play is in progress for the specific purpose of preventing a goal, a Penalty Shot will be awarded to the non-offending team, in addition to a Minor penalty (see Rule 4.11 (a)(i) – Penalty Shots). If a goal is scored by the non-offending team before the stoppage of play, then the Penalty Shot will not be awarded, but the Minor penalty for Too Many Players will be assessed.
No Major penalty may be assessed for Too Many Players.
No Match penalty may be assessed for Too Many Players.
No Misconduct penalty may be assessed for Too Many Players.
No Game Misconduct penalty may be assessed for Too Many Players.

rule.title: Refusing to Start Play
rule.text: No team or individual may refuse to start play or leave the ice without the permission of the Referee. No excuses will be tolerated.

subsection.text: A team that refuses to be on the ice and ready to start play within 2 minutes from the time the Referee has called the teams to the face-off or after the completion of the ice flooding between periods, will be assessed a Bench Minor penalty.
No Major penalty may be assessed for Refusing to Start Play.
No Match penalty may be assessed for Refusing to Start Play.
No Misconduct penalty may be assessed for Refusing to Start Play.
No Game Misconduct penalty may be assessed for Refusing to Start Play.
No Gross Misconduct penalty may be assessed for Refusing to Start Play.

rule.title: Refusing to Leave Players' or Penalty Bench
rule.text: This rule applies to any player who has been ordered from the ice but refuses to leave. This rule also applies to any player who has been ordered from the game or has incurred a Game Misconduct penalty but returns to the Players' or Penalty Bench, or to the ice surface.

subsection.text: No Minor penalty may be assessed to a player who refuses to leave the ice surface when ordered to do so by the Referee.
No Major penalty may be assessed to a player who refuses to leave the ice surface when ordered to do so by the Referee.
No Match penalty may be assessed to a player who refuses to leave the ice surface when ordered to do so by the Referee.
No Misconduct penalty may be assessed to a player who refuses to leave the ice surface when ordered to do so by the Referee.
No Game Misconduct penalty may be assessed to a player who refuses to leave the ice surface when ordered to do so by the Referee.

A Gross Misconduct penalty will be assessed to any player who refuses to leave the ice surface or Players' or Penalty Bench when ordered to do so by the Referee after they have been assessed any penalty or have been ordered from the game. Any player who has been ordered from the game and returns to the Players' or Penalty Bench, or to the ice surface, will be assessed a second Gross Misconduct penalty (see also Rule 4.7 (a)(iii) – Misconduct Penalties).

rule.title: Unsportsmanlike Conduct
rule.text: Players (including all benched players), coaches and other team officials are expected to act in a manner consistent with the spirit of the game, including treating opponents, officials, trainers, and the facilities with respect. Unsportsmanlike conduct refers to any conduct or action that demonstrates disrespect or intimidation towards an opponent, official, coach, or trainer. This includes, but is not limited to:

subsection.text: A Minor penalty will be assessed to any player, team official, or team who: i. Uses obscene, profane, or threatening language or gestures. ii. Makes a "travesty of" or otherwise interferes with the game. iii. Deliberately prevents an Official from retrieving a puck. iv. After a warning by the Referee, persists in any conduct, including following an Official off the ice. v. Knocks or shoots the puck out of reach of an Official who is retrieving it. vi. Causes a disturbance during the game, including banging the boards with a stick or other instrument.

A Bench Minor penalty will be assessed to any team, team official, or player who engages in disruptive or otherwise inappropriate verbal comments, including gender identity, race, religion, sexual orientation, or any other personal characteristics. Subsequent violation of this rule will result in a Game Misconduct, as noted in (e) below.
No Match penalty may be assessed for Unsportsmanlike Conduct.

A Misconduct penalty will be assessed to any player, excluding team officials who: i. When penalized, does not proceed immediately and directly to the Penalty Bench or dressing room and remain there until the penalty has expired. ii. After receiving a warning from the Referee, persists with any verbal objection to an official's ruling. iii. After being prevented from doing so, persists in any action covered under (a).

A Game Misconduct penalty will be assessed to any player or team official who: i. Uses discriminatory language. ii. Persists with any verbal objection to an official's ruling, after being assessed a Misconduct penalty (a double Misconduct).
A Gross Misconduct penalty will be assessed to any player or team official whose behaviour or actions, on or off the ice, constitute a mockery of the game.

rule.title: Disrespectful, Abusive, and Harassing Behaviour
rule.text: A standard of reasonable conduct must be applied to all hockey participants. The safety and well-being of all participants in the sport must be the first priority for all Hockey Canada members. It is the responsibility of all players, coaches, team officials, and members to promote respectful conduct during all hockey activities, and to take proactive measures against all forms of disrespectful conduct and bullying.

subsection.text: A Minor penalty will be assessed to any player who engages in disrespectful, abusive, or harassing behaviour or bullying towards another participant or spectator.
No Major penalty may be assessed for Disrespectful, Abusive, or Harassing Behaviour.

A Match penalty will be assessed to any team official who engages in disrespectful, abusive, or harassing behaviour or bullying towards another participant or spectator. Such behaviour will be reported to the appropriate Member or league and may result in further sanctions.

A Misconduct penalty will be assessed to any player who, after being assessed a Minor penalty under subsection (a), continues to engage in disrespectful, abusive, or harassing behaviour, either on the same stoppage of play or any subsequent stoppage in the game.

A Game Misconduct penalty will be assessed to any player who, after being assessed a Misconduct penalty under subsection (d), continues to engage in disrespectful, abusive, or harassing behaviour, as a "double Misconduct".
No Gross Misconduct penalty may be assessed for Disrespectful, Abusive, or Harassing Behaviour.

rule.title: Spitting
rule.text: Spitting is the act of forcefully discharging saliva or other substances from the mouth onto a person.

subsection.text: A Minor penalty will be assessed to any player who spits on or at any person, except where Rule 11.3 (c) would apply.
No Major penalty may be assessed for Spitting.

A Match penalty will be assessed to any player or team official who deliberately spits on or at an opponent, Official, team official, or spectator. Such behaviour will be reported to the appropriate Member or league and may result in further sanctions.
No Misconduct penalty may be assessed for Spitting.
No Game Misconduct penalty may be assessed for Spitting.
No Gross Misconduct penalty may be assessed for Spitting.

rule.title: Discrimination
rule.text: Any player, team official, team, or member that engages in verbal taunts, insults, or intimidation based on discriminatory grounds will be assessed a penalty. Discriminatory grounds include, but are not limited to, the following: race, national or ethnic origin, skin colour, religion, age, gender identity, gender expression, sexual orientation, marital or family status, and disability. Such behaviour may also be reported to the Member or League for potential supplementary discipline proceedings.

subsection.text: No Minor penalty may be assessed for Discrimination.
No Major penalty may be assessed for Discrimination.

A Match penalty will be assessed to any player or team official who engages in any verbal taunts, insults, or intimidation on the basis of discrimination. Such behaviour must be reported to the Member or league and may result in further sanctions.
No Misconduct penalty may be assessed for Discrimination.
No Game Misconduct penalty may be assessed for Discrimination.

A Gross Misconduct penalty will be assessed to any player or team official who utters, makes, or communicates defamatory remarks, comments, or statements that are deemed degrading on the basis of discrimination. Such behaviour must be reported to the Member or league and may result in further sanctions.

rule.title: Physical Harassment of Officials
rule.text: Any player or team official who, before, during, or after a game, deliberately attempts to or deliberately inflicts physical harm to any Game Official, or deliberately applies physical force in any manner against an Official, with intent to injure, or who attempts to, or deliberately attempts to strike an Official, will be subject to significant penalties. This may include, but is not limited to, grabbing, holding, or spitting on or at an Official, or deliberately striking an Official with the hand, stick, puck, or any other object.

subsection.text: No Minor penalty may be assessed for Physical Harassment of Officials.
No Major penalty may be assessed for Physical Harassment of Officials.

A Match penalty will be assessed to any player or team official who: i. Deliberately strikes, trips, or body-checks, or applies physical force in any manner against an Official. ii. Deliberately throws or shoots any object at an Official. iii. Deliberately inflicts physical harm, or attempts to do so, to any Game Official or Team Official. iv. Threatens to inflict further physical harm on any Game Official or Team Official. v. Attempts to continue a fight or altercation after they have been ordered to stop or resists the linesperson in the discharge of their duties. vi. Deliberately applies physical force to an Official solely for the purpose of getting free of such an Official during or immediately following an altercation.
No Misconduct penalty may be assessed for Physical Harassment of Officials.
No Game Misconduct penalty may be assessed for Physical Harassment of Officials.
No Gross Misconduct penalty may be assessed for Physical Harassment of Officials.
